verbose_text: Despite the widely accepted association between histamine and scombroid food poisoning, histamine alone appears to be insufficient to cause toxicity, and putrescine and cadaverine have been suggested to potentiate its toxic activity by inhibiting the intestinal histamine metabolizing enzymes, diamine oxidase and histamine N-methyltranferase.
evidence: putrescine and cadaverine have been suggested to potentiate its toxic activity by inhibiting the intestinal histamine
